review: Not only did it meet my expectations, it exceeded them. Initially I had just wanted to watch TV in bed without having to pay for another cable box. The one time payment of $35 was a low low price to pay for that. Especially when Comcast was asking an additional $35 per month just to have an additional box.What I didn't know is how it would affect other areas in my life. With the Chrome Cast my wife can watch TV in the bedroom while I play video games in the living room. This has drastically reduced arguments over whether I need to watch another episode of House Hunters or Property Brothers, and whether I really need to "level up" one more time before "So you Think You Can Dance" comes on.I can safely say that this little device has saved what was otherwise a doomed marriage.Thanks Google. And Amazon. And America.

review: I purchased this primarily as an experiment (the price was low enough).  I like the form factor - though it is slightly misleading.  Most of you will end up needing to plug in the additional AC adapter.  Usability is decent, though setup took longer than I would like on the device.  In the end, I'm not really sold on the concept of the purely thin client (that is, a pure streaming device vs. something like an Apple TV or Roku that offers services).  The toll of running your battery down when streaming, plus degraded quality on pass-through streaming just made me switch back to my other set-top boxes again and again.Still, a neat device, but one that just isn't ready to cross over to the mainstream market when superior alternatives are available at affordable (given their value) price points.
